etymologies: Old English rǣdere ‘interpreter of dreams, reader’

definitions: a person who reads or who is fond of reading

examples.text: the books of Roald Dahl appeal to young readers

shortDefinitions: person who reads or who is fond of reading

definitions: a person who reads a particular newspaper, magazine, or text
shortDefinitions: person who reads particular newspaper or text

definitions: a person entitled to use a particular library.
shortDefinitions: person entitled to use particular library

definitions: a person who reads and reports to a publisher or producer on the merits of manuscripts submitted for publication or production, or who provides critical comments on the text prior to publication.
shortDefinitions: person who reads and reports to publisher or producer on merits of manuscripts submitted for publication or production

definitions: a person who inspects and records the figure indicated on a measuring instrument
shortDefinitions: person who inspects and records figure indicated on measuring instrument

definitions: a book containing extracts of a particular author's work or passages of text designed to give learners of a language practice in reading.
shortDefinitions: book containing extracts of text or texts, designed to give learners of language practice in reading

definitions: a university lecturer of the highest grade below professor

examples.text: Dr. Gardiner is Reader in Mathematics

shortDefinitions: university lecturer of highest grade below professor

definitions: a machine for producing on a screen a magnified, readable image of any desired part of a microfiche or microfilm.
shortDefinitions: device that produces on screen magnified, readable image of microfiche or microfilm

definitions: a device or piece of software used for reading or obtaining data stored on tape, cards, or other media.
shortDefinitions: device or piece of software used for reading or obtaining data stored on media
